page.title: 18THE LEARNING PROCESS.
page.content: Shrewsbury is served by twelve primary schools and three secondary schools, one of which is a{Sixth Form College. Five primary schools cater for infant aged children only, and three have special classes for nursery children. In all 2293 children attend primary schools which means on average there are 22 children for every teacher employed.In the secondary schools it works out at 1 teacher to every 14.5 children.Nursery classes are used to {prepare children for school life. Children draw,paint,dress up and generally learn how to get on with each other.At the{infant/junior schools most of the work is centred around a{topic}which is supported by Maths,English and Art.{Secondary {Schools}are much bigger and offer subjects varying from Languages, Sciences,Craftwork,Humanities and P.E.
